comments.body:
Hmm, I think that this needs to be specified something like this:

```typescript
capture(id: string, response?: IResponseFn<charges.ICharge>): Promise<charges.ICharge>;
capture(id: string, data: charges.IChargeCaptureOptions, response?: IResponseFn<charges.ICharge>): Promise<charges.ICharge>;
capture(id: string, options: HeaderOptions, response?: IResponseFn<charges.ICharge>): Promise<charges.ICharge>;
capture(id: string, data: charges.IChargeCaptureOptions, options: HeaderOptions, response?: IResponseFn<charges.ICharge>): Promise<charges.ICharge>;
```

since all of this calls are okay:

```js
capture(id)
capture(id, (err) => {})
capture(id, data)
capture(id, data, (err) => {})
capture(id, options)
capture(id, options, (err) => {})
capture(id, data, options)
capture(id, data, options, (err) => {})
```

note that the Stripe client differs `data` from `options` by looking at the keys in the object

any thoughts @lauvigne, @DanielRosenwasser?
Yes you are right, it's better!
